abstract: Warren Buffett’s investment in Bank of America was unable to turn the market around in the face of rising jobless claims.
snippet: Warren Buffett’s investment in Bank of America was unable to turn the market around in the face of rising jobless claims.
lead_paragraph: Traders have been overwhelmed by the prospects of a global economic slowdown, a euro zone debt problem and other issues. On Thursday, there were new developments to contend with: the resignation of Steven P. Jobs as chief executive of Apple and the investment by Berkshire Hathaway, which is run by Warren E. Buffett, in Bank of America.

headline.main: Shares Fall as Hopes Fade for New Action by Fed and Jobless Claims Rise
headline.print_headline: Shares Fall as Hopes Fade for New Action by Fed and Jobless Claims Rise

abstract: On Thursday, Berkshire Hathaway, run by Warren E. Buffett, announced plans to invest $5 billion in Bank of America, a vote of confidence for the beleaguered financial firm.
snippet: On Thursday, Berkshire Hathaway, run by Warren E. Buffett, announced plans to invest $5 billion in Bank of America, a vote of confidence for the beleaguered financial firm.
lead_paragraph: 1:04 p.m. | Updated Warren E. Buffett comes to the rescue, again.

headline.main: Buffett Invests $5 Billion in Bank of America

byline.original: By Ben Protess and Susanne Craig

abstract: While he is investing $5 billion into Bank of America, Warren E. Buffett is no stranger to taking up positions in the nation’s biggest lenders.
snippet: While he is investing $5 billion into Bank of America, Warren E. Buffett is no stranger to taking up positions in the nation’s biggest lenders.
lead_paragraph: With his $5 billion investment in Bank of America, Warren E. Buffett is adding yet another American financial giant to his stock portfolio.

headline.main: Buffett Adds Another Bank to His Portfolio

keywords.name: organizations
keywords.value: Bank of New York Mellon Corp

byline.original: By Michael J. de la Merced and Susanne Craig

abstract: Bank of America got a better deal than Goldman did when Warren Buffett rescued it in 2008. But no rescue would have been necessary if B of A had not decided to make its own rescue, of Countrywide Financial.
snippet: Bank of America got a better deal than Goldman did when Warren Buffett rescued it in 2008. But no rescue would have been necessary if B of A had not decided to make its own rescue, of Countrywide Financial.
lead_paragraph: Warren Buffett rode to the rescue of Bank of America today, as he did for Goldman Sachs in the dark days of September 2008.

abstract: Bank of America’s price for getting Warren E. Buffett’s seal of approval may not be as steep as what Goldman Sachs and General Electric have paid. But it will cost the firm $9.51 a second.
snippet: Bank of America’s price for getting Warren E. Buffett’s seal of approval may not be as steep as what Goldman Sachs and General Electric have paid. But it will cost the firm $9.51 a second.
lead_paragraph: Warren E. Buffett is among the nation’s best deal-makers, and in the $5 billion investment he struck with Bank of America, he’s getting a guaranteed profit.

headline.main: What Buffett Is Getting From His Bank of America Deal

byline.original: By Michael J. de la Merced

abstract: On Thursday, Berkshire Hathaway, run by Mr. Buffett, announced plans to invest $5 billion in Bank of America, a vote of confidence for the beleaguered financial firm.
